This is pretty common. It’s debatable if using ferrules are good idea or not when connecting to the PHD/PDP but it’s common. Some teams also use them to into the wago inline connectors but in general that will make them too large to fit, if you don’t modify the wires.

In our last regional we used these pins, but we do not recommend them because at least in the way we used them we suffered from a feeding problem in our pigeon, but they are legal.

This is likely an issue with how you were using the ferrules or poor quality ferrules.

Most of the ferrules are rated to work for only two wire sizes. Wires more than one wire size larger or smaller would require using a different size of ferrule.

I had bad experiences with crimped connectors purchased from online suppliers that are not focused on selling connectors or electronic components. The materials were inferior such that the connectors/ferrules would not stay on after crimping.
